<DOCUMENT>
<TYPE>EX-10.AA3
<SEQUENCE>5
<FILENAME>exhibit10-aa3.htm
<DESCRIPTION>DAN MEEK RETENTION AGREEMENT JANUARY 9, 2006
<TEXT>
<HTML>
<HEAD>
<TITLE></TITLE>
</HEAD>

<BODY><P align=right><FONT face=serif size=2>Exhibit (10) AA3.</FONT></P>

<P align=left><FONT face=serif size=2>January 9, 2006</FONT></P>

<P align=left><FONT face=serif size=2>Mr. Daniel T. Meek<BR></FONT><FONT face=serif size=2>(address intentionally omitted)</FONT></P>

<P align=left><FONT face=serif size=2>Dear Dan:</FONT></P>

<P align=left><FONT face=serif size=2>By way of letter agreements dated July 31, 1998 (the &#147;1998 Agreement&#148;) and June 25, 2001 (the &#147;2001 Agreement&#148;), Eastman Kodak Company (&#147;Kodak&#148;) and you agreed to certain terms regarding your employment. The purpose of this letter (the &#147;2005 Agreement&#148;), which will become an agreement once both you and Kodak sign it, is to supplement the 1998 and 2001 Agreements as set forth herein. The 2005 Agreement supersedes the 1998 and 2001 Agreements to the extent inconsistent therewith.</FONT></P>

<P align=left><B><FONT face=serif size=2>1.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Base Salary and Wage Grade</FONT></B></P>

<P align=left><FONT face=serif size=2>Effective July 19, 2005, your base salary will be at the rate of $500,000 per year and your wage grade will be 64.</FONT></P>

<P align=left><B><FONT face=serif size=2>2.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Long-Term Incentive and Retention Plan</FONT></B></P>

<TABLE cellSpacing=0 cellPadding=0 border=0>
<TR>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap><B><FONT face=serif size=2>A.</FONT></B></TD>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>
<TD vAlign=top width="100%"><B><FONT face=serif size=2>In General</FONT></B><FONT face=serif size=2>. Subject to the terms of this Section 2, you will be eligible to participate in a long-term incentive and retention plan (the &#147;Plan&#148;) based on the development and execution of significant direct controllable cost reductions associated with the restructuring of Global Manufacturing &amp; Logistics (&#147;GM&amp;L&#148;) during the three-year period commencing January 1, 2005 and ending December 31, 2007. The purpose of this Plan is to incent you to achieve certain long-term pre-established goals with respect to GM&amp;L during these three years and to remain in your current role through December 2007. The Plan will be performance-based and, therefore, any payment under the Plan will be contingent upon satisfaction of the Plan&#146;s performance goals.</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD vAlign=top width="100%" colSpan=3>&nbsp;</TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap><B><FONT face=serif size=2>B.</FONT></B></TD>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap></TD>
<TD vAlign=top width="100%"><B><FONT face=serif size=2>Target Awards and Performance Goals</FONT></B><FONT face=serif size=2>. The target awards and performance goals are described in the materials presented at the July 19, 2005 meeting of the Executive Compensation and Development Committee of the Board of Directors (the &#147;Compensation Committee&#148;). The Oversight Committee (as defined in Subsection (G) below), in its sole discretion, will determine which costs are direct controllable costs, the amount of reduction with respect to such costs, and the amount of the award with respect to reduction amounts that fall between the amounts presented to the Compensation Committee.</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD vAlign=top width="100%" colSpan=3>&nbsp;</TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap><B><FONT face=serif size=2>C.</FONT></B></TD>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap></TD>
<TD vAlign=top width="100%"><FONT face=serif size=2><B>Continued Employment</B>. Except as provided in Subsection (D) below, in order to receive an award under the Plan, it will be necessary for you to remain continuously employed by Kodak through the Retention Date (as defined in Section 3(C)(ii) below). If, prior to such date, your employment terminates for any reason, other than as set forth in Subsection (D) below, you will forfeit in entirety any award under the Plan.</FONT></TD></TR>
</TABLE>

<BR>
<HR align=center width="100%" noShade SIZE=2>


<PAGE>

<P align=left><FONT size=2>Mr. Daniel T. Meek<BR>January 9, 2006</FONT></P>
<BR>
<TABLE cellSpacing=0 cellPadding=0 border=0>
<TR>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap><B><FONT face=serif size=2>D.</FONT></B></TD>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>
<TD vAlign=top width="100%" colSpan=3><B><FONT face=serif size=2>Termination of Employment</FONT></B><FONT face=serif size=2>. Notwithstanding Subsection (C) above to the contrary, if, prior to the Retention Date (as defined in Section 3(C)(ii) below), you die or terminate employment as a result of a Disability (as defined in Section 3(D)), you will receive a pro-rated award under the Plan. The amount of the pro- rated award will be determined from the award you would have otherwise received had you remained employed through the Retention Date (as defined in Section 3(C)(ii) below) and be based on the savings generated as of the date you die or terminate employment as a result of a Disability and the savings generated over the 12 months immediately following such date resulting from the direct controllable cost reduction actions taken as of such date. If Kodak terminates your employment without Cause (as defined in Section 3(C)) or you terminate employment for Good Reason (as defined in this
Subsection (D)), you will receive the maximum award available under the Plan. For purposes of this letter, the term &#147;Good Reason&#148; shall mean, without your consent:</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap></TD>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap></TD>
<TD vAlign=top width="100%" colSpan=3>&nbsp;</TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap></TD>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap></TD>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap><FONT size=2>i.</FONT></TD>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>
<TD vAlign=top width="100%"><FONT size=2>Any action by Kodak or its employees which results in a material diminution in your position, authority, duties, or responsibilities (other than any diminution contemplated under Section 2), excluding any action which is remedied by Kodak within fifteen (15) days after receipt of written notice given by you specifying the nature of the material diminution of your position, authority, duties or responsibilities;</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap></TD>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap></TD>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap></TD>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap></TD>
<TD vAlign=top width="100%">&nbsp;</TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap></TD>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap></TD>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap><FONT size=2>ii.</FONT></TD>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap></TD>
<TD vAlign=top width="100%"><FONT size=2>Kodak requiring you to relocate to a principal place of employment outside of the continental United States; or</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap></TD>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap></TD>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap></TD>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap></TD>
<TD vAlign=top width="100%">&nbsp;</TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap></TD>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap></TD>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap><FONT size=2>iii.</FONT></TD>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap></TD>
<TD vAlign=top width="100%"><FONT size=2>Any failure by Kodak to comply with any of the provisions in this agreement other than a failure which is remedied by Kodak with ten (10) days after receipt of written notice given by you specifying the nature of the failure.</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap></TD>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap></TD>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap></TD>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap></TD>
<TD vAlign=top width="100%">&nbsp;</TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap><B><FONT size=2>E.</FONT></B></TD>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap></TD>
<TD vAlign=top width="100%" colSpan=3><B><FONT face=serif size=2><B>Payment</B></FONT></B><FONT face=serif size=2>. By February 15, 2008, or as soon thereafter as is administratively practicable, the Oversight Committee (as defined in Subsection (G) below) will determine the amount of the award, if any, you have earned under the Plan. The award will be paid in a single, lump-sum payment in shares of Kodak common stock on or before March 15, 2008.</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap></TD>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap></TD>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap></TD>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap></TD>
<TD vAlign=top width="100%">&nbsp;</TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap><B><FONT size=2><B>F.</B></FONT></B></TD>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap></TD>
<TD vAlign=top width="100%" colSpan=3><B><FONT face=serif size=2><B>Benefits Bearing.</B></FONT></B> <FONT face=serif size=2>In no event will any award under the Plan be &#147;benefits bearing.&#148; In other words, the amount will not be taken into account, or considered for any reason, for purposes of determining any company provided benefits or compensation to which you become eligible, including, by way of illustration and not by way of limitation, any pension or other retirement benefit.</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap></TD>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap></TD>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap></TD>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap></TD>
<TD vAlign=top width="100%">&nbsp;</TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap><B><FONT size=2><B>G.</B></FONT></B></TD>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap></TD>
<TD vAlign=top width="100%" colSpan=3><FONT face=serif size=2><B>Administration.</B> The award will be administered by a committee consisting of the Kodak employees with the following titles: Chief Executive Officer, Director of Human Resources, and Director of Corporate Finance, Planning and Analysis (the &#147;Oversight Committee&#148;), with the Director of Worldwide Compensation as secretary, in accordance with the terms of this letter agreement. The Oversight Committee will have total and exclusive responsibility to control, operate, manage and administer the Plan in accordance with its terms and all the authority that may be necessary or helpful to enable it to discharge its responsibilities with respect to the Plan. Without limiting the generality of the preceding sentence, the Oversight Committee will have the exclusive right to: interpret the Plan, decide all questions concerning eligibility for and the amount of awards payable under the Plan, construe any ambiguous provision of the Plan,
correct any default, supply any omission, reconcile any inconsistency, and decide all questions arising in the administration, interpretation and application of the Plan. The Oversight Committee will have full discretionary authority in all matters related to the discharge of its responsibilities and the exercise of its authority under the Plan, including, without limitation, its construction of the terms of the Plan and its determination of eligibility for awards under the Plan. It is the intent of the Plan, as well as both parties hereto, that the decisions of the Oversight Committee and its actions with respect to the Plan will be final and binding upon all persons having or claiming to have any right or interest in or under the plan and that no such decision or actions shall be modified upon judicial review unless such decision or action is proven to be arbitrary or capricious; provided, however, that while you are employed by Kodak you can, within 10 days of the Oversight Committee&#146;s
decision with respect to actual performance against the Plan&#146;s performance goals, request that the Committee reconsider such decision, which the Committee must do in good faith within 30 days of such request.</FONT></TD></TR>
</TABLE>

<P align=left><B><FONT face=serif size=2>3.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Severance Benefits</FONT></B></P>

<TABLE cellSpacing=0 cellPadding=0 border=0>
<TR>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap><B><FONT face=serif size=2>A.</FONT></B></TD>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>
<TD vAlign=top width="100%" colSpan=3><B><FONT face=serif size=2>In General</FONT></B><FONT face=serif size=2>. If, on or before the Retention Date (as defined in Subsection (C)(ii) below), Kodak terminates your employment for reasons other than &#147;Cause&#148; (as defined in Subsection (D) below), your employment terminates because of a &#147;Disability&#148; (as defined in Subsection (E) below), or Kodak is unable to offer you a reasonably comparable position commensurate with your experience and background, Kodak will provide you with the following severance benefits, subject to your satisfaction of the terms of this Section 3:</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap></TD>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap></TD>
<TD vAlign=top width="100%" colSpan=3>&nbsp;</TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap></TD>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap></TD>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap><B><FONT size=2><B>i.</B></FONT></B></TD>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>
<TD vAlign=top width="100%"><B><FONT size=2><B>Severance Allowance</B></FONT></B><FONT face=serif size=2>. Kodak will pay you a severance allowance equal to two (2) times your then-current annual total target compensation (base salary plus target award under the Executive Compensation for Excellence and Leadership plan (&#147;EXCEL&#148;)) This amount will be paid in equal monthly installments over the twelve-month period commencing on the six-month anniversary of your last day of work. Kodak will withhold from the severance allowance all income, payroll and employment taxes required by applicable law or regulation to be withheld. This severance allowance will be paid to you in lieu of any other severance benefit, payment or allowance for which you would otherwise be eligible, except any benefits payable to you under Kodak&#146;s Termination Allowance Plan (&#147;TAP&#148;) or any successor plan thereto. To the extent, however, you are eligible for a severance benefit under TAP (or any successor
plan), the benefits payable to you under this section shall be reduced by (a) the amount of such severance benefit, and (b) any enhancement to such severance benefit by reason of the 1998 Agreement. In no event will any of this severance allowance be &#147;benefits bearing,&#148; as defined in Section 2(F) above. Kodak will withhold from this severance allowance all income, payroll and employment taxes required by applicable law or regulation to be withheld.</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap></TD>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap></TD>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap></TD>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap></TD>
<TD vAlign=top width="100%">&nbsp;</TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap></TD>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap></TD>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap><B><FONT size=2><B>ii.</B></FONT></B></TD>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap></TD>
<TD vAlign=top width="100%"><B><FONT size=2><B>Continuation of Existing Health, Dental and Basic Life Insurance Coverages.</B></FONT></B> <FONT face=serif size=2>Your elections under the Kodak Medical Assistance Plan (&#147;Kmed&#148;) and the Kodak Dental Assistance Plan (&#147;Kdent&#148;) and for Basic Coverage under the Kodak Life Insurance Plus Plan at the time you terminate employment will be continued, and fully paid by Kodak, until the last day of the fourth month immediately following the month of your termination from employment; provided, however, that you will receive the benefits described in this Subsection 3(A)(ii) only if, at the time you terminate, Kodak-paid continuation of benefits under these plans is provided to similarly situated employees who become eligible for benefits under TAP.</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap></TD>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap></TD>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap></TD>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap></TD>
<TD vAlign=top width="100%">&nbsp;</TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap></TD>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap></TD>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap><B><FONT size=2><B>iii.</B></FONT></B></TD>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap></TD>
<TD vAlign=top width="100%"><B><FONT size=2><B>Outplacement Services.</B></FONT></B> <FONT face=serif size=2>You will receive outplacement services similar to, and subject to the same terms and conditions as, such services, if any, provided under TAP to similarly situated employees at the time of your termination of employment.</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap></TD>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap></TD>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap></TD>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap></TD>

<TD vAlign=top noWrap></TD>
<TD vAlign=top width="100%"><B><FONT size=2><B>Financial Counseling Services.</B></FONT></B> <FONT face=serif size=2>You will receive executive financial counseling services similar to, and subject to the same terms and conditions as, such services, if any, provided by Kodak to similarly situated employees at the time of your termination of employment; provided, however, that such services will end on the earlier of (a) the date provided in any applicable governing documents with respect to these services, or (b) March 15 of the year immediately following the year in which you terminate employment.</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap></TD>

<TR>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap></TD>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap></TD>

<TD vAlign=top noWrap></TD>
<TD vAlign=top width="100%"><B><FONT size=2><B>Agreement, Waiver and Release.</B></FONT></B> <FONT face=serif size=2>You must execute immediately prior to your termination of employment a waiver, general release and covenant not to sue in favor of Kodak (the &#147;Agreement, Waiver and Release&#148;), in a form satisfactory to the Senior Vice President and Director, Human Resources, of Kodak. In the event you breach any of the terms of the Eastman Kodak Company Employees&#146; Agreement or the Agreement, Waiver and Release, in addition to and not in lieu of, any other remedies that Kodak may pursue against you, no further severance allowance payments will be made to your pursuant to this section and you agree to immediately repay to Kodak all moneys previously paid to you pursuant to this section.</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap></TD>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap></TD>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap></TD>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap></TD>
<TD vAlign=top width="100%">&nbsp;</TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap></TD>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap></TD>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap><B><FONT size=2><B>ii.</B></FONT></B></TD>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap></TD>
<TD vAlign=top width="100%"><B><FONT size=2><B>Continued Employment</B></FONT></B><FONT face=serif size=2>. You must remain continuously employed by Kodak until the Retention Date. If, prior to the Retention Date, your employment terminates for any reason, other than as set forth in the next sentence, you will forfeit in entirety any benefits provided under this Section 3. Notwithstanding the immediately preceding sentence to the contrary, if, prior to the Retention Date (as defined in the next sentence), you terminate employment as a result of a Disability (as defined in Subsection (E) below), you terminate employment for Good Reason (as defined in Section 2(D)), or Kodak terminates your employment without Cause (as defined in Subsection (D) below), you will still receive the benefits described in this Section 3. For purposes of this letter, &#147;Retention Date&#148; shall mean a date determined by the Administrator (as defined in Subsection (F) below), which shall not be later than March 31,
2008.</FONT></TD></TR>

<TD vAlign=top width="100%" colSpan=3><B><FONT face=serif size=2>Cause</FONT></B><FONT face=serif size=2>. For purposes of this letter, &#147;Cause&#148; shall mean:</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap></TD>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap></TD>
<TD vAlign=top width="100%" colSpan=3>&nbsp;</TD></TR>

<TD vAlign=top noWrap><FONT size=2>i.</FONT></TD>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>
<TD vAlign=top width="100%"><FONT size=2>your continued failure, for a period of at least 30 calendar days following a written warning, to perform your duties in a manner deemed satisfactory by your supervisor, in the exercise of his/her sole discretion; or</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap></TD>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap></TD>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap></TD>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap></TD>
<TD vAlign=top width="100%">&nbsp;</TD></TR>

<TD vAlign=top noWrap></TD>
<TD vAlign=top width="100%"><FONT size=2>your failure to follow a lawful written directive of the Chief Executive Officer or your supervisor; or</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap></TD>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap></TD>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap></TD>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap></TD>

<TD vAlign=top noWrap></TD>
<TD vAlign=top width="100%"><FONT size=2>your willful violation of any material rule, regulation, or policy that may be established from time to time for the conduct of Kodak&#146;s business; provided, however, that for the purposes of determining whether conduct constitutes willful violation, no act on your part shall be considered &#147;willful&#148; unless it is done by you in bad faith and without reasonable belief that your action was in the best interests of Kodak;; or</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap></TD>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap></TD>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap></TD>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap></TD>
<TD vAlign=top width="100%">&nbsp;</TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap></TD>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap></TD>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap><FONT size=2>iv.</FONT></TD>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap></TD>
<TD vAlign=top width="100%"><FONT size=2>your unlawful possession, use or sale of narcotics or other controlled substances, or, performing job duties while illegally used controlled substances are present in your system; or</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap></TD>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap></TD>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap></TD>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap></TD>

<TD vAlign=top noWrap></TD>
<TD vAlign=top width="100%"><FONT size=2>any act of omission or commission by you in the scope of your employment (a) which results in the assessment of a civil or criminal penalty against you or Kodak, or (b) which in the reasonable judgment of your supervisor could result in a material violation of any foreign or U.S. federal, state or local law or regulation having the force of law; or</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap></TD>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap></TD>

<TR>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap></TD>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap></TD>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap></TD>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap></TD>

<P align=left><B><FONT face=serif size=2>4.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Pension Benefits</FONT></B></P>

<TABLE cellSpacing=0 cellPadding=0 border=0>
<TR>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap><B><FONT face=serif size=2>A.</FONT></B></TD>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>
<TD vAlign=top width="100%"><B><FONT face=serif size=2>In General</FONT></B><FONT face=serif size=2>. Subject to the terms of this Section 4, Kodak agrees to calculate your retirement and survivor benefits under the Kodak Retirement Income Plan (&#147;KRIP&#148;), Kodak Unfunded Retirement Income Plan (KURIP&#148;) and Kodak Excess Retirement Income Plan (&#147;KERIP&#148;) by adding 3 years to your age, and crediting you with an additional 3 years of service for purposes of determining your Accrued and Total Service (as those terms are defined in KRIP). This enhancement is in addition to the deemed service described in Section 10 of the 1998 Agreement. The benefits payable as a result of this enhancement will be offset by the benefits payable to you under KRIP, KURIP, KERIP and Section 10 of the 1998 Agreement. The amount of the offset shall be determined by the Administrator (as defined in Subsection (E) below), using whatever assumptions he or she deems reasonable, in his or her sole discretion. In
no event will any benefits paid under this Section 4 be &#147;benefits bearing,&#148; as defined in Section 2(F) above.</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD vAlign=top width="100%" colSpan=3>&nbsp;</TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap><B><FONT face=serif size=2>B.</FONT></B></TD>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap></TD>
<TD vAlign=top width="100%"><B><FONT face=serif size=2>Continued Employment</FONT></B><FONT face=serif size=2>. Except as provided in Subsection (C) below, in order to receive the benefits described in this Section 4, it will be necessary for you to remain continuously employed by Kodak through the Retention Date (as defined in Section 3(C)(ii) above). If, prior to such date, your employment terminates for any reason, other than as set forth in Subsection (C) below, you will not be entitled to the benefits described in this Section 4.</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD vAlign=top width="100%" colSpan=3>&nbsp;</TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap><B><FONT face=serif size=2>C.</FONT></B></TD>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap></TD>
<TD vAlign=top width="100%"><B><FONT face=serif size=2>Termination of Employment</FONT></B><FONT face=serif size=2>. Notwithstanding Subsection (B) above to the contrary, if, prior to the Retention Date (as defined in Section 3(C)(ii)), (i) you die, (ii) terminate employment as a result of a Disability (as defined in Section 3(D)), (iii) terminate employment for Good Reason (as defined in Section 2(D)), or (iv) Kodak terminates your employment without Cause (as defined in Section 3(C)), you will still receive the benefits described in this Section 4.</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD vAlign=top width="100%" colSpan=3>&nbsp;</TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap><B><FONT face=serif size=2>D.</FONT></B></TD>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap></TD>
<TD vAlign=top width="100%"><B><FONT face=serif size=2>Payment.</FONT></B> <FONT face=serif size=2>The amount of the benefits, if any, payable to you pursuant to this Section 4 will: (i) be paid in the form of a lump sum payment within 60 days after your termination of employment; (ii) be paid out of Kodak&#146;s general assets, not under KRIP; (iii) not be funded in any manner; and (iv) be included in your gross income as ordinary income, subject to all income, payroll and employment tax withholdings required to be made under all applicable federal, state and local law or regulation.</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap></TD>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap></TD>
<TD vAlign=top width="100%">&nbsp;</TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap><B><FONT size=2>E.</FONT></B></TD>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap></TD>
<TD vAlign=top width="100%"><B><FONT size=2><B>Administration</B></FONT></B><FONT face=serif size=2>. The benefit described in this Section 4 will be administered by the Kodak employee with the title Director of Human Resources (&#147;Administrator&#148;), who will have the same authority with respect to the benefits provided in this Section 4 as the Oversight Committee has with respect to the benefits provided in Section 2, as described in Section 2(G) above.</FONT></TD></TR>
</TABLE>

<BR>
<P align=right><FONT face=serif size=2>Page 5 of 8</FONT></P>

<HR align=center width="100%" noShade SIZE=2>


<PAGE>

<P align=left><FONT size=2>Mr. Daniel T. Meek<BR>January 9, 2006</FONT></P>

<P align=left><B><FONT face=serif size=2>5.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Miscellaneous</FONT></B></P>

<TABLE cellSpacing=0 cellPadding=0 border=0>
<TR>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap><B><FONT face=serif size=2>A.</FONT></B></TD>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>
<TD vAlign=top width="100%"><B><FONT face=serif size=2>Confidentiality</FONT></B><FONT face=serif size=2>. You agree to keep the content and existence of this letter agreement confidential except that you may review it with your supervisor, attorney, financial advisor, and/or with me or my designee. Prior to any such disclosure, you agree to advise these individuals of the confidential nature of this letter agreement and the facts giving rise to it as well as their obligations to maintain the confidentiality of this letter agreement and the facts giving rise to it.</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD vAlign=top width="100%" colSpan=3>&nbsp;</TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap><B><FONT face=serif size=2>B.</FONT></B></TD>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap></TD>
<TD vAlign=top width="100%"><B><FONT face=serif size=2>Tax Liability.</FONT></B> <FONT face=serif size=2>By signing this letter agreement you agree that the Company has not provided you with advice regarding the tax treatment of any of the benefits or payments provided hereunder. You hereby acknowledge that Kodak will not report any such amounts as taxable (or make any related withholding of tax) under Section 409A of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as amended, or administrative guidance thereunder, and you agree to indemnify and hold the Company harmless for any liability associated with such reporting and withholding treatment.</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD vAlign=top width="100%" colSpan=3>&nbsp;</TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap><B><FONT face=serif size=2>C.</FONT></B></TD>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap></TD>
<TD vAlign=top width="100%"><B><FONT face=serif size=2>Section 409A of the Internal Revenue Code.</FONT></B> <FONT face=serif size=2>The arrangements described in this letter agreement are intended to comply with Section 409A of the Internal Revenue Code to the extent such arrangements are subject to that law. The parties agree that they will negotiate in good faith regarding amendments necessary to bring the arrangements into compliance with the terms of that Section or an exemption therefrom as interpreted by guidance issued by the Internal Revenue Service; provided, however, that Kodak may unilaterally amend this agreement for purposes of compliance if, in it&#146;s sole discretion, Kodak determines that such amendment would not have a material adverse effect with respect to your rights under the agreement. The parties further agree that to the extent an arrangement described in this letter fails to qualify for exemption from or satisfy the requirements of Section 409A, the affected arrangement may
be operated in compliance with Section 409A pending amendment to the extent authorized by the Internal Revenue Service. In such circumstances Kodak will administer the letter in a manner which adheres as closely as possible to the existing terms and intent of the letter while complying with Section 409A. This paragraph does not restrict Kodak&#146;s rights (including, without limitation, the right to amend or terminate) with respect to arrangements described in this letter to the extent such rights are reserved under the terms of such arrangements.</FONT></TD></TR>
</TABLE>

<HR align=center width="100%" noShade SIZE=2>


<PAGE>

<P align=left><FONT size=2>Mr. Daniel T. Meek<BR>January 9, 2006</FONT></P>
<BR>
<TABLE cellSpacing=0 cellPadding=0 border=0>
<TR>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap><B><FONT face=serif size=2>D.</FONT></B></TD>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>
<TD vAlign=top width="100%"><B><FONT face=serif size=2>Unenforceability</FONT></B><FONT face=serif size=2>. If any portion of this letter agreement is deemed to be void or unenforceable by a court of competent jurisdiction, the remaining portions will remain in full force and effect to the maximum extent allowed by law. The parties intend and desire that each portion of this letter agreement be given the maximum possible effect allowed by law.</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD vAlign=top width="100%" colSpan=3>&nbsp;</TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap><B><FONT face=serif size=2>E.</FONT></B></TD>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap></TD>
<TD vAlign=top width="100%"><B><FONT face=serif size=2>Headings</FONT></B><FONT face=serif size=2>. The heading of the several sections of this letter agreement have been prepared for convenience and reference only and shall not control, affect the meaning, or be taken as the interpretation of any provision of this letter agreement.</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD vAlign=top width="100%" colSpan=3>&nbsp;</TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap><B><FONT face=serif size=2>F.</FONT></B></TD>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap></TD>
<TD vAlign=top width="100%"><B><FONT face=serif size=2>Applicable Law.</FONT></B> <FONT face=serif size=2>This letter agreement, and its interpretation and application, will be governed and controlled by the laws of the State of New York, applicable as though to a contract made in New York by residents of New York and wholly to be performed in New York without giving effect to principles of conflicts of law. Disputes arising under this letter agreement shall be adjudicated within the exclusive jurisdiction of a state or federal court located in Monroe County, New York. Neither party waives any right it may have to remove such an action to the United States Federal District Court located in Monroe County, New York.</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD vAlign=top width="100%" colSpan=3>&nbsp;</TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap><B><FONT face=serif size=2>G.</FONT></B></TD>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap></TD>
<TD vAlign=top width="100%"><B><FONT face=serif size=2>Amendment.</FONT></B> <FONT face=serif size=2>Except as provided in Subsection (C), this letter agreement may not be changed, modified, or amended, other than in a writing signed by both you and Kodak which expressly acknowledges that it is changing, modifying or amending this letter agreement.</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD vAlign=top width="100%" colSpan=3>&nbsp;</TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap><B><FONT face=serif size=2>H.</FONT></B></TD>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap></TD>
<TD vAlign=top width="100%"><B><FONT face=serif size=2>Forfeiture.</FONT></B> <FONT face=serif size=2>In the event that you violate any provision of this letter agreement, in addition to, and not in lieu of, any other remedies that Kodak may pursue against you, no further severance benefits will be made to you hereunder and you agree to immediately repay all severance benefits previously paid to you pursuant to this letter agreement. In such event all other provisions of this letter agreement will remain in full force and effect as though the breach had not occurred.</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD vAlign=top width="100%" colSpan=3>&nbsp;</TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap><B><FONT face=serif size=2>I.</FONT></B></TD>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap></TD>
<TD vAlign=top width="100%"><B><FONT face=serif size=2>Plan Documents Control.</FONT></B> <FONT face=serif size=2>To extent that the terms of this letter agreement relate to a compensation or benefit plan (including, without limitation, Kmed, EXCEL, stock options, Leadership Stock, restricted stock and restricted stock units), such terms are subject to the provisions of the applicable governing documents (such as plan documents, administrative guides and award notices), which are subject to change.</FONT></TD></TR>
</TABLE>

</DOCUMENT>
<DOCUMENT>
<TYPE>EX-10.AA4
<SEQUENCE>6
<FILENAME>exhibit10-aa4.htm
<DESCRIPTION>DAN MEEK TERMINATION AGREEMENT DATED MAY 2, 2006
<TEXT>
<HTML>
<HEAD>
<TITLE></TITLE>
</HEAD>

<BODY><P align=right><FONT face=serif size=2>Exhibit (10) AA4.</FONT></P>

<P align=left><B><FONT face=serif size=2>Personal &amp; Confidential </FONT></B></P>

<P align=left><FONT face=serif size=2>May 2, 2006 </FONT></P>

<P align=left><FONT face=serif size=2>Mr. Daniel T. Meek<BR></FONT><FONT face=serif size=2>(address intentionally omitted) </FONT></P>

<P align=left><FONT face=serif size=2>Dear Dan: </FONT></P>

<P align=left><FONT face=serif size=2>By way of letter agreements dated July 31, 1998 (the &#147;1998 Agreement&#148;), June 25, 2001 (the &#147;2001 Agreement&#148;) and January 9, 2006 (the &#147;2006 Retention Agreement&#148;), Eastman Kodak Company (&#147;Kodak&#148;) and you agreed to certain terms regarding your employment. The purpose of this letter (the &#147;2006 Termination Agreement&#148;), which will become an agreement once both you and Kodak sign it, is to supplement the 1998, 2001 and 2006 Retention Agreements (collectively, the &#147;Prior Agreements&#148;) as set forth herein. The 2006 Termination Agreement supersedes the Prior </FONT><FONT face=serif size=2>Agreements to the extent inconsistent therewith.</FONT></P>

<P align=left><B><FONT face=serif size=2>1.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Last Day of Work </FONT></B></P>

<P align=left><FONT face=serif size=2>It is hereby agreed that your last day of employment by Kodak will be on June 30, 2006 (the &#147;Last Day of Work&#148;), or such other date to which the parties hereto mutually agree, unless you resign or are terminated at an earlier date under the terms of this letter agreement.</FONT></P>

<P align=left><B><FONT face=serif size=2>2.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Responsibilities</FONT></B></P>

<P align=left><FONT face=serif size=2>During the remainder of your employment by Kodak, you will perform such duties and responsibilities as are identified by or on behalf of the person to whom you report, and be responsible for performing those transition expectations identified by such person. It is expected that you will perform these duties, responsibilities and expectations in a timely and satisfactory manner, and your receipt of the benefits described in this letter agreement is contingent on your satisfaction of this condition. </FONT></P>

<P align=left><B><FONT face=serif size=2>3.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Long-Term Incentive and Retention Plan </FONT></B></P>

<P align=left><FONT face=serif size=2>Pursuant to Section 2 of the 2006 Retention Agreement, because your termination is involuntary without cause, you will receive the maximum award available under the Plan, $1,395,000.00, which will be paid in a single, lump-sum payment in shares of Kodak common stock in 2008, on or before March 15, 2008, and is subject to any and all conditions in the 2006 Retention Agreement. </FONT></P>

<P align=left><B><FONT face=serif size=2>4.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Severance Benefits</FONT></B></P>

<P align=left><FONT face=serif size=2>Pursuant to Section 3 of the 2006 Retention Agreement, You will receive a severance allowance in an amount equal to $1,620,000.00, which will be paid over the twelve-month period commencing on the six-month anniversary of your Last Day of Work, and is subject to any and all conditions in the 2006 Retention Agreement. Payments will be substantially equivalent and generally made consistently with Kodak&#146;s normal payroll cycles (currently bi-weekly), but no less frequently than monthly. You will also receive the other benefits discussed in Section 3 of the 2006 Retention Agreement (continuation of health, dental and basic life insurance coverages, outplacement services and financial counseling services), as described therein. In order to receive the severance allowance and other benefits described in this Section 4 and Section 3 of the 2006 Retention Agreement, you must execute prior to your termination of employment the Agreement, Waiver and Release annexed
hereto as Addendum A. In the event you either fail to sign or, once signed, make an effective revocation of Addendum A, you will not be entitled to any of these severance benefits. </FONT></P>

<HR align=center width="100%" noShade SIZE=2>


<PAGE>

<P align=left><FONT face=serif size=2>Mr. Daniel T. Meek<BR>May 2, 2006 </FONT></P>

<P align=left><B><FONT face=serif size=2>5.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Pension Benefits</FONT></B></P>

<P align=left><FONT face=serif size=2>Pursuant to Section 4 of the 2006 Retention Agreement and Section 10 of the 1998 Agreement, you will receive an enhanced pension payment as a result of the deemed service granted under the 2006 Retention and 1998 Agreements, subject to any and all conditions in such Agreements. This amount will be paid in the form of a single lump sum cash payment within 60 days after your Last Day of Work. </FONT></P>

<P align=left><B><FONT face=serif size=2>6.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Executive Compensation for Excellence and Leadership </FONT></B></P>

<P align=left><FONT face=serif size=2>You will be eligible for a pro-rated award under the Executive Compensation for Excellence and Leadership (&#147;EXCEL&#148;) plan for the 2006 performance period in accordance with the terms of EXCEL. Any award made to you will be paid at the normal time of payout.</FONT></P>

<P align=left><FONT face=serif size=2>You hereby acknowledge and agree that individual performance is but one factor that is taken into account in determining awards under EXCEL. Other factors that are taken into account include company performance, unit performance, and discretion by the Executive Compensation and Development Committee of the Board of Directors (the &#147;Compensation Committee&#148;), Kodak&#146;s CEO and the participant&#146;s supervisor. Given this, you further acknowledge and agree that the </FONT><FONT face=serif size=2>Compensation Committee&#146;s determination with regard to the amount and payment of any EXCEL award paid to you for 2006 will be final and binding upon you, and any other person having or claiming to have any right or interest on your behalf in or under the plan. </FONT></P>

<P align=left><B><FONT face=serif size=2>7.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Stock Options</FONT></B></P>

<P align=left><FONT face=serif size=2>Subject to your satisfaction of the terms of this letter agreement, your termination of employment will, for purposes of any stock options held by you on your termination of employment, be treated as an &#147;Approved Reason&#148; under the terms of the applicable governing documents. Thus, you will not forfeit any stock options you hold on the Last Day of Work as a result of your termination of employment under this letter agreement; rather, they will vest and expire in accordance with, and are otherwise subject in all respects to, the terms of the applicable governing documents.</FONT></P>

<P align=left><B><FONT face=serif size=2>8.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Leadership Stock Program </FONT></B></P>

<P align=left><FONT face=serif size=2>Subject to your satisfaction of the terms of this letter agreement, your termination of employment will be treated as for an &#147;Approved Reason&#148; pursuant to the terms of Kodak&#146;s Leadership Stock Program. You therefore will be eligible for a full award for the program&#146;s 2004-2005 performance cycle, and a prorated award for the program&#146;s 2005-2006 performance cycle. Any award made to you with respect to either of these cycles will be paid following certification by the Compensation Committee of the Company&#146;s performance for the entire performance cycle, pursuant to the terms of the Leadership Stock Program. With respect to the 2006-2007 performance cycle, since you will be terminating your employment during the first year of this two-year performance cycle, you will not be eligible for any award under the Leadership Stock Program for such cycle, and thereby forfeit any and all rights to receive an award therefor.</FONT></P>

<P align=right><FONT face=serif size=2>Page 2 of 11</FONT></P>

<HR align=center width="100%" noShade SIZE=2>


<PAGE>

<P align=left><FONT face=serif size=2>Mr. Daniel T. Meek<BR>May 2, 2006 </FONT></P>

<P align=left><B><FONT face=serif size=2>9.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Employee&#146;s Agreement</FONT></B></P>

<P align=left><FONT face=serif size=2>During your employment by Kodak, you signed an &#147;Eastman Kodak Company Executive </FONT><FONT face=serif size=2>Employee&#146;s Agreement (the &#147;Employee&#146;s Agreement&#148;)&#148; in which you affirmed your obligation not to disclose Company trade secrets or confidential or proprietary information. Further, you agreed not to engage in work or activities on behalf of a competitor of the Company in the field in which you were employed by Kodak for a period following termination of your employment by Kodak equal to the total number of months you were employed by Kodak, but in no event less than six (6) months or more than eighteen (18) months. By signing this letter agreement, you reaffirm your Employee&#146;s Agreement and agree that it is in full force and effect, without amendment or modification. </FONT></P>

<P align=left><B><FONT face=serif size=2>10.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Cooperation</FONT></B></P>

<P align=left><FONT face=serif size=2>You agree to cooperate fully with Kodak from now to the date of your termination of employment and thereafter during the two (2) year period following your termination, taking into account the demands of any subsequent employment by you with a third party after the Last Day of Work, on all matters relating to your employment and termination of employment, the transition of your duties and responsibilities to your successor(s), and the conduct of Kodak&#146;s business. You further agree during such periods to cooperate fully with Kodak regarding, and conduct all of your actions, statements and communications in a manner consistent with, the announcement by Kodak of your termination of employment.</FONT></P>

<P align=left><FONT face=serif size=2>In partial consideration for the severance benefits described above, you also agree that during the period commencing on the date of this letter and ending on the second anniversary of the Last Day of Work, you will not in any way disparage, make any statement, or take any action which is adverse, inimical or otherwise detrimental to the interests of the Company or any of its current or former officers, directors, and employees or cause any of such persons embarrassment or humiliation or otherwise cause or contribute to such persons being held in disrepute by the public or the Company&#146;s shareholders, clients, customers, employees or competitors. Kodak also agrees that during such period of time, its officers and directors will not in any way disparage, make any statement, or take any action which is adverse, inimical or otherwise detrimental to you or cause you embarrassment or humiliation or otherwise cause or contribute to your being held in disrepute by
the public or the Company&#146;s shareholders, clients, customers, employees or competitors. </FONT></P>

<P align=left><B><FONT face=serif size=2>11.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Injunctive Relief</FONT></B></P>

<P align=left><FONT face=serif size=2>You acknowledge by accepting the benefits under this letter agreement and the Prior Agreements that any breach or threatened breach by you of any term of Sections 9 or 10 hereof cannot be remedied solely by the recovery of damages or the withholding of benefits and the Company will therefore be entitled to an injunction against such breach or threatened breach without posting any bond or other security. Nothing herein, however, will prohibit the Company from pursuing, in connection with an injunction or otherwise, any other remedies available at law or in equity for such breach or threatened breach, including the recovery of damages. </FONT></P>

<P align=left><B><FONT face=serif size=2>12.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Vacation</FONT></B></P>

<P align=left><FONT face=serif size=2>Upon your termination of employment, you will receive payment in lieu of all your earned and unused available carried-over and then-current vacation.</FONT></P>

<P align=right><FONT face=serif size=2>Page 3 of 11</FONT></P>

<HR align=center width="100%" noShade SIZE=2>


<PAGE>

<P align=left><FONT face=serif size=2>Mr. Daniel T. Meek<BR>May 2, 2006 </FONT></P>

<P align=left><B><FONT face=serif size=2>13.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Miscellaneous</FONT></B></P>

<TD vAlign=top noWrap>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </TD>
<TD vAlign=top width="100%"><B><FONT face=serif size=2>Confidentiality</FONT></B><FONT face=serif size=2>. Prior to any such disclosure, you agree to advise these individuals of the confidential nature of this letter agreement and the facts giving rise to it as well as their obligations to maintain the confidentiality of this letter agreement and the facts giving rise to it.</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD vAlign=top width="100%" colSpan=3>&nbsp;</TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap><B><FONT face=serif size=2>B.</FONT></B></TD>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap></TD>
<TD vAlign=top width="100%"><B><FONT face=serif size=2>Tax Liability. </FONT></B><FONT face=serif size=2>By signing this letter agreement you agree that the Company has not provided you with advice regarding the tax treatment of any of the benefits or payments provided hereunder, including without limitation those benefits set forth in Section 3. You hereby acknowledge that Kodak will not report any such amounts as taxable (or make any related withholding of tax) under Section 409A of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as amended, or administrative guidance thereunder, and you agree to indemnify and hold the Company harmless for any liability associated with such reporting and withholding treatment.</FONT></TD></TR>

The parties agree that they will negotiate in good faith regarding amendments necessary to bring the arrangements into compliance with the terms of that Section or an exemption therefrom as interpreted by guidance issued by the Internal Revenue Service; provided, however, that Kodak may unilaterally amend this agreement for purposes of compliance if, in it&#146;s sole discretion, Kodak determines that such amendment would not have a material adverse effect with respect to your rights under the agreement. The parties further agree that to the extent an arrangement described in this letter fails to qualify for exemption from or satisfy the requirements of Section 409A, the affected arrangement may
be operated in compliance with Section 409A pending amendment to the extent authorized by the Internal Revenue Service. In such circumstances Kodak will administer the letter in a manner which adheres as closely as possible to the existing terms and intent of the letter while complying with Section 409A. This paragraph does not restrict Kodak&#146;s rights (including, without limitation, the right to amend or terminate) with respect to arrangements described in this letter to the extent such rights are reserved under the terms of such arrangements.</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD vAlign=top width="100%" colSpan=3>&nbsp;</TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap><B><FONT face=serif size=2>D.</FONT></B></TD>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap></TD>
<TD vAlign=top width="100%"><B><FONT face=serif size=2>Unenforceability</FONT></B><FONT face=serif size=2>. If any portion of this letter agreement is deemed to be void or unenforceable by a court of competent jurisdiction, the remaining portions will remain in full force and effect to the maximum extent allowed by law. The parties intend and desire that each portion of this letter agreement be given the maximum possible effect allowed by law.</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD vAlign=top width="100%" colSpan=3>&nbsp;</TD></TR>

Disputes arising under this letter agreement shall be adjudicated within the exclusive jurisdiction of a state or federal court located in Monroe County, New York. Neither party waives any right it may have to remove such an action to the United States Federal District Court located in Monroe County, New York.</FONT></TD></TR>

<TABLE cellSpacing=0 cellPadding=0 border=0>

<TD vAlign=top noWrap><B><FONT face=serif size=2>G.</FONT></B></TD>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </TD>
<TD vAlign=top width="100%"><B><FONT face=serif size=2>Amendment. </FONT></B><FONT face=serif size=2>This letter agreement may not be changed, modified, or amended, except in a writing signed by both you and Kodak which expressly acknowledges that it is changing, modifying or amending this letter agreement.</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD vAlign=top width="100%" colSpan=3>&nbsp;</TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap><B><FONT face=serif size=2>H.</FONT></B></TD>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap></TD>
<TD vAlign=top width="100%"><B><FONT face=serif size=2>Forfeiture. </FONT></B><FONT face=serif size=2>In the event that you violate any provision of this letter agreement, including Addendum &#147;A&#148;, or your Employee&#146;s Agreement, in addition to, and not in lieu of, any other remedies that Kodak may pursue against you, no further severance benefits will be made to you hereunder and you agree to immediately repay all severance benefits previously paid to you pursuant to this letter agreement. In such event all other provisions of this letter agreement will remain in full force and effect as though the breach had not occurred.</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD vAlign=top width="100%" colSpan=3>&nbsp;</TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap><B><FONT face=serif size=2>I.</FONT></B></TD>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap></TD>
<TD vAlign=top width="100%"><B><FONT face=serif size=2>Plan Documents Control. </FONT></B><FONT face=serif size=2>To extent that the terms of this letter agreement relate to a compensation or benefit plan (including, without limitation, EXCEL, stock options, Leadership Stock, restricted stock and restricted stock units), such terms are subject to the provisions of the applicable governing documents (such as plan documents, administrative guides and award notices), which are subject to change.</FONT></TD></TR>
</TABLE>


<P align=left><FONT face=serif size=2>Your signature below means that: </FONT></P>

<TABLE cellSpacing=0 cellPadding=0 border=0>
<TR>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap><FONT face=serif size=2>1.</FONT></TD>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </TD>
<TD vAlign=top width="100%"><FONT face=serif size=2>You have had ample opportunity to discuss the terms and conditions of this letter agreement with an attorney and/or financial advisor of your choice and as a result fully understand its terms and conditions; and</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD vAlign=top width="100%" colSpan=3>&nbsp;</TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap><FONT face=serif size=2>2.</FONT></TD>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap></TD>
<TD vAlign=top width="100%"><FONT face=serif size=2>You accept the terms and conditions set forth in this letter agreement; and</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD vAlign=top width="100%" colSpan=3>&nbsp;</TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap><FONT face=serif size=2>3.</FONT></TD>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap></TD>
<TD vAlign=top width="100%"><FONT face=serif size=2>This letter agreement, including in particular its reference regarding the continuing effectiveness of your Employee&#146;s Agreement, supersedes and replaces any and all agreements or understandings, whether written or oral, that you may have with the Company concerning your termination of employment and any special or other separation, termination, retirement or compensation arrangement.</FONT></TD></TR>
</TABLE>

<PAGE>

<P align=left><FONT face=serif size=2>Mr. Daniel T. Meek<BR>May 2, 2006 </FONT></P>

<P align=left><B><FONT face=serif size=2>ADDENDUM A</FONT></B></P>

<P align=left><U><FONT face=serif size=2>AGREEMENT, WAIVER AND RELEASE</FONT></U></P>

<TABLE cellSpacing=0 cellPadding=0 border=0>
<TR vAlign=bottom>
<TD vAlign=top align=left width="1%"><B><FONT face=serif size=2>NOTICE:</FONT></B></TD>
<TD vAlign=top align=left width="1%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </TD>
<TD vAlign=top align=left width="97%"><B><FONT face=serif size=2>YOU ARE ADVISED TO CONSULT WITH AN ATTORNEY PRIOR TO EXECUTING THIS AGREEMENT.</FONT></B></TD></TR>
</TABLE>

<BR>
<P align=left><FONT face=serif size=2>This Agreement, Waiver and Release (the &#147;Agreement&#148;) is a contract between the undersigned employee (&#147;you&#148;) and your employer, Eastman Kodak Company (&#147;Kodak&#148;), dated ____________. Your Last Day of Work is defined in the letter agreement between yourself and Kodak to which this Agreement is attached as Addendum A (&#147;Letter Agreement&#148;).</FONT></P>

<P align=left><B><FONT face=serif size=2>1.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Benefits</FONT></B><FONT face=serif size=2> </FONT></P>

<P align=left><FONT face=serif size=2>In consideration for signing this Agreement, you will receive the benefits (the &#147;Termination Benefits&#148;) described in the Letter Agreement. </FONT></P>

<P align=left><B><FONT face=serif size=2>2.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Release</FONT></B><FONT face=serif size=2> </FONT></P>

<P align=left><FONT face=serif size=2>In consideration for the Termination Benefits, you hereby release and discharge Kodak, its parent corporations, subsidiaries, affiliates, benefit plans and their plan administrators, successors and assigns and their respective directors, officers, employees and agents (hereinafter collectively referred to as the &#147;Releasees&#148;), both individually and in their official capacity, from all claims, actions and causes of action of any kind, which you, or your agents, executors, heirs, or assigns ever had, now have, or may have, whether known or unknown, as a result of your employment by or termination of employment from Kodak.</FONT></P>

<P align=right><FONT face=serif size=2>Page 6 of 11</FONT></P>

<HR align=center width="100%" noShade SIZE=2>


<PAGE>

<P align=left><FONT face=serif size=2>Mr. Daniel T. Meek<BR>May 2, 2006 </FONT></P>

<P align=left><FONT face=serif size=2>As a result, you will be prevented from suing Kodak under any law, rule, regulation, or common law theory, including, but not limited to, the following:</FONT></P>

<UL>
<LI>
<P align=left><FONT face=serif size=2>any federal, state or local law, regulation or executive order prohibiting discrimination on account of age, race, sex, sexual orientation, national origin, religion, disability, marital status, citizenship, color, or veteran status;</FONT></P>

<LI>
<P align=left><FONT face=serif size=2>the Age Discrimination In Employment Act of 1967, as amended;</FONT></P>

<LI>
<P align=left><FONT face=serif size=2>Title VII of the Civil Rights Act of 1964, as amended;</FONT></P>

<LI>
<P align=left><FONT face=serif size=2>the Civil Rights Act of 1866, as amended;</FONT></P>

<LI>
<P align=left><FONT face=serif size=2>the Employee Retirement Income Security Act, as amended;</FONT></P>

<LI>
<P align=left><FONT face=serif size=2>the Americans with Disabilities Act, as amended;</FONT></P>

<LI>
<P align=left><FONT face=serif size=2>the Family and Medical Leave Act, as amended;</FONT></P>

<LI>
<P align=left><FONT face=serif size=2>the National Labor Relations Act, as amended;</FONT></P>

<LI>
<P align=left><FONT face=serif size=2>the Equal Pay Act; as amended;</FONT></P>

<LI>
<P align=left><FONT face=serif size=2>claims for wrongful discharge, unjust dismissal, or constructive discharge;</FONT></P>

<LI>
<P align=left><FONT face=serif size=2>claims for breach of any alleged oral, written or implied contract of employment;</FONT></P>

<LI>
<P align=left><FONT face=serif size=2>claims for salary, severance payments, bonuses or other compensation of any kind (except as permitted under Section 3 below);</FONT></P>

<LI>
<P align=left><FONT face=serif size=2>claims for benefits (except as permitted under Section 3 below);</FONT></P>

<LI>
<P align=left><FONT face=serif size=2>claims for libel, slander, defamation and attorneys&#146; fees; and</FONT></P>

<LI>
<P align=left><FONT face=serif size=2>any other claims under federal, state or local statute, law, rule or regulation, as amended, or under common law. </FONT></P>
</LI></UL>
<P align=right><FONT face=serif size=2>Page 7 of 11</FONT></P>

<HR align=center width="100%" noShade SIZE=2>


<PAGE>

<P align=left><FONT face=serif size=2>Mr. Daniel T. Meek<BR>May 2, 2006 </FONT></P>

<P align=left><B><FONT face=serif size=2>3.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Release Exclusions</FONT></B></P>

<P align=left><FONT face=serif size=2>Excluded from the scope of this Release are claims for the following compensation and benefits:</FONT></P>

<UL>
<LI>
<P align=left><FONT face=serif size=2>Claims for benefits to which you may be eligible under the terms of the following benefit plans, as such plans may be amended from time to time: Kodak Retirement Income Plan, Kodak Unfunded Retirement Income Plan, Kodak Excess Retirement Income Plan, Eastman Kodak Employees&#146; Savings and Investment Plan, and Kodak Employee Stock Ownership Plan; </FONT></P>

<LI>
<P align=left><FONT face=serif size=2>Claims for retiree health care or dental services rendered after your termination, or life insurance benefits to which you may become entitled after your termination under any Company health care, dental, or life insurance plan, as such plans may be amended from time to time;</FONT></P>

<LI>
<P align=left><FONT face=serif size=2>Claims for expenses incurred by you or your covered family members prior to your termination of employment under the Kodak Medical Assistance Plan or the Kodak Dental Plan; </FONT></P>

<LI>
<P align=left><FONT face=serif size=2>Claims for accrued, but unpaid and unused, benefits under the Vacation Plan; </FONT></P>

<LI>
<P align=left><FONT face=serif size=2>Any claims that may arise after the date this Agreement is executed unrelated to your employment or the termination of your employment; </FONT></P>

<LI>
<P align=left><FONT face=serif size=2>Claims for any amounts or awards due you under the Eastman Kodak Company 1982 Executive Deferred Compensation Plan; </FONT></P>

<LI>
<P align=left><FONT face=serif size=2>Claims with respect to any injury compensable under applicable Workers&#146; Compensation statutes; </FONT></P>

<LI>
<P align=left><FONT face=serif size=2>Claims under the Fair Labor Standards Act; and </FONT></P>

<LI>
<P align=left><FONT face=serif size=2>Claims for benefits and compensation owing to you under the Letter Agreement. </FONT></P>
</LI></UL>
<P align=left><B><FONT face=serif size=2>4.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; No Future Lawsuits</FONT></B><FONT face=serif size=2> </FONT></P>

<P align=left><FONT face=serif size=2>In addition to any and all other obligations you may have under the terms of this Agreement, you also separately and independently covenant and agree that, to the extent allowed by law, you will not sue Releasees upon any of the claims that you have released in Section 2 of this Agreement or assist any other person or entity in bringing any lawsuit against Kodak in any state or federal court with the exception of lawsuits based upon claims listed in Section 3. </FONT></P>

<P align=left><B><FONT face=serif size=2>5.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Cooperation</FONT></B></P>

<P align=left><FONT face=serif size=2>You understand that Kodak may need your continued cooperation and involvement with various pieces of litigation and other legal matters which are pending at the time of your termination of employment or which may arise thereafter. In further consideration of the Termination Benefits, you agree, at Kodak&#146;s request from time to time, to cooperate with Kodak in its efforts to defend and/or pursue any such litigation or other legal matters. You will provide this assistance to Kodak at no additional remuneration beyond the Termination Benefits. When performing these services at Kodak&#146;s request, except where prohibited by law, Kodak will consider reimbursing you for reasonable travel and lodging expenses that you incur upon submission of documentation acceptable to Kodak. By way of illustration and not by way of limitation, the types of services that may be requested of you under this Section 5 include: attending strategy sessions, attending preparations for
trial, appearing at depositions, executing affidavits and testifying at trials.</FONT></P>

<P align=left><B><FONT face=serif size=2>6.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Return of Kodak Property </FONT></B></P>

<P align=left><FONT face=serif size=2>Whether or not you sign this Agreement, you, as a terminating employee, are reminded that prior to your termination of employment you must return to Kodak, (i) all documents, and other tangible items, and any copies, that are in your possession or control and which contain confidential information in written, magnetic or other form and shall have not given such documents, items, or copies to anyone other than another Kodak employee; and (ii) all other Kodak property within your possession including, but not limited to, office keys, identification badges or passes, Kodak credit cards, automobiles, and computer equipment and software. You understand and acknowledge your continuing obligation regarding the disclosure of confidential, proprietary and trade secret information which you have obtained during your employment with Kodak.</FONT></P>

<P align=right><FONT face=serif size=2>Page 8 of 11</FONT></P>

<HR align=center width="100%" noShade SIZE=2>


<PAGE>

<P align=left><FONT face=serif size=2>Mr. Daniel T. Meek<BR>May 2, 2006 </FONT></P>

<P align=left><B><FONT face=serif size=2>7.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Eastman Kodak Company Executive Employee&#146;s Agreement </FONT></B></P>

<P align=left><FONT face=serif size=2>Whether or not you sign this Agreement, you, as a terminating employee, are reminded that the Eastman Kodak Company Executive Employee&#146;s Agreement (the &#147;Executive Employee&#146;s Agreement&#148;) entered into between Kodak and yourself remains in full force and effect after termination of your employment. Under the Executive Employee&#146;s Agreement, you reaffirmed your obligation not to disclose Kodak trade secrets, confidential or proprietary information. Also, under the terms of the Executive Employee&#146;s Agreement, you agreed not to engage in work or activities on behalf of any competitor of Kodak in the field in which you were employed by Kodak for a period following termination of your employment equal to the total number of months you were employed by Kodak, but in no event less than six (6) months or more than eighteen (18) months. </FONT></P>

<P align=left><B><FONT face=serif size=2>8.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Breach</FONT></B></P>

<P align=left><FONT face=serif size=2>You agree that if you violate any part of this Agreement or the Executive Employee&#146;s Agreement described in Section 7 above, you will be responsible for all costs incurred by Kodak that flow from that violation, including Kodak&#146;s legal fees and other costs associated with any legal action that arises from that violation. You also agree that if you violate any part of this Agreement or the Executive Employee&#146;s Agreement, you will not be entitled to the Termination Benefits. </FONT></P>

<P align=left><FONT face=serif size=2>You further agree that any breach or threatened breach by you of this Agreement cannot be remedied solely by the recovery of damages and Kodak shall therefore be entitled to any injunction against such breach or threatened breach without posting any bond or other security. Nothing herein, however, shall be construed as prohibiting Kodak from pursuing, in connection with an injunction or otherwise, any other remedies available at law or equity for such breach or threatened breach, including the recovery of damages. </FONT></P>

<P align=left><B><FONT face=serif size=2>9.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Confidentiality</FONT></B><FONT face=serif size=2> </FONT></P>

<P align=left><FONT face=serif size=2>In further consideration of the Termination Benefits, you agree that the content of Letter Agreement, any other agreements between you and Kodak and this Agreement will be kept confidential and will not be disclosed to any person or entity, except to your attorney, financial advisor/planner or spouse, or except as required by law. Nonetheless, either party to this Agreement (that is, you and Kodak) may disclose to any and all persons, without limitation of any kind the tax treatment and tax structure of this transaction and all materials of any kind (including opinions or other tax analyses) that may be provided to the party relating to tax treatment and tax structure. </FONT></P>

<P align=right><FONT face=serif size=2>Page 9 of 11</FONT></P>

<HR align=center width="100%" noShade SIZE=2>


<PAGE>

<P align=left><FONT face=serif size=2>Mr. Daniel T. Meek<BR>May 2, 2006 </FONT></P>

<P align=left><B><FONT face=serif size=2>10.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Period of Review and Other Considerations </FONT></B></P>

<TR>

<TD width="100%" colSpan=3>&nbsp;</TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap><B><FONT face=serif size=2>c.</FONT></B></TD>

You understand that in the event you execute this Agreement within less than 21 days of the date of its delivery to you, you acknowledge that such decision was entirely voluntary and that you have had the opportunity to consider this Agreement for the entire 21 day period.</FONT></TD></TR>
</TABLE>

<BR>
<TABLE cellSpacing=0 cellPadding=0 border=0>
<TR>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap><B><FONT face=serif size=2>d.</FONT></B></TD>
<TD noWrap>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </TD>
<TD width="100%"><B><FONT face=serif size=2>Entire Agreement</FONT></B><FONT face=serif size=2>. This Agreement, including in particular its reference regarding the continuing effectiveness of the Executive Employee&#146;s Agreement and the Letter Agreement to which this Agreement is attached, sets forth the entire agreement between Kodak and yourself and supersedes and renders null and void any and all prior or contemporaneous oral or written understandings, statements, representations or promises regarding the subject matter hereof. This Agreement does not, however, supersede the Letter Agreement to which this Agreement is attached and the Executive Employee&#146;s Agreement which remain in full force and effect.</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD width="100%" colSpan=3>&nbsp;</TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap><B><FONT face=serif size=2>e.</FONT></B></TD>
<TD noWrap></TD>
<TD width="100%"><B><FONT face=serif size=2>Governing Law</FONT></B><FONT face=serif size=2>. This Agreement shall be construed and governed by the laws of the State of New York without giving effect to principles of conflicts of laws. Disputes arising under this Agreement shall be adjudicated within the exclusive jurisdiction of a state or federal court located in Monroe County, New York. Neither party waives any right it may have to remove such an action to the United States Federal District Court located in Monroe County, New York. If any provision of this Agreement including, but not limited to, the waiver of claims under any particular statute, should be deemed unenforceable, the remaining provisions shall, to the extent possible, be carried into effect, taking into account the general purpose and spirit of this Agreement.</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD width="100%" colSpan=3>&nbsp;</TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap><B><FONT face=serif size=2>f.</FONT></B></TD>
<TD noWrap></TD>
<TD width="100%"><B><FONT face=serif size=2>Revocation of Agreement</FONT></B><FONT face=serif size=2>. You understand that you have the right to revoke this Agreement within 7 days of your signing it, and that this Agreement shall not become effective or enforceable until this 7 day period has expired. To revoke this Agreement, you agree to notify in writing: Director, Human Resources and Senior Vice President, Eastman Kodak Company, 343 State Street, Rochester, NY 14650. Unless so revoked, this Agreement will be effective at 5:00 p.m. on such seventh day. You agree that if you exercise your right to revoke this Agreement within 7 days, your termination of employment will nevertheless occur, you will not be entitled to the Termination Benefits, and you will immediately return to Kodak any consideration you have already received.</FONT></TD></TR>
</TABLE>

YOU ACKNOWLEDGE THAT THE CONSIDERATION YOU ARE RECEIVING IN EXCHANGE FOR EXECUTING THIS AGREEMENT IS GREATER THAN THAT WHICH YOU WOULD BE ENTITLED TO IN THE ABSENCE OF THIS AGREEMENT. YOU HAVE NOT RELIED UPON ANY REPRESENTATION OR STATEMENT, WRITTEN OR ORAL, NOT SET FORTH IN THIS AGREEMENT.</FONT></B></P>
